newsitem.title: USA: Lockheed Martin earnings up 8 percent.
newsitem.headline: Lockheed Martin earnings up 8 percent.

text.p: Lockheed Martin said Tuesday its earnings rose 8 percent in the third quarter and cited cost-cutting and increased sales due to its acquisition of Loral Corp.
The Bethesda, Md.-based defence company said it earned $311 million, or $1.55 a share, in the third quarter vs. $287 million, or $1.43 a share.
Sales rose 27 percent to $7.03 billion from $5.55 billion. The company said the increase in sales was due mostly to its acquisition in April of Loral Corp.
Lockheed Martin's earnings per share were on target with Wall Street expectations, but its shares fell $1 to $91.75 on the New York Stock Exchange.
Lockheed said it expected savings of $2.5 billion a year after 1999 as a result of its restructuring and a government policy of sharing defence consolidation costs and savings with contractors.
In addition the company said its order backlog in the third quarter fell to $49.1 billion from $50.1 billion in the second quarter, partly as a result of the end of the goverernment's fiscal year.

For the first nine months, Lockheed earned $882 million, or $4.40 a share, on sales of $19.21 billion. A year earlier, the company earned $371 million, or $1.72 a share, on sales of $16.80 billion. The year earlier period included charges of $690 million, or $1.96 a share, related to merger expenses.
